name: U.S. State Department
body:
## GitHub For The Department of State
 
To better comply with The White House's [Open Government Initiative](http://www.whitehouse.gov/open) and President Obama's [Executive Order -- Making Open and Machine Readable the New Default for Government Information](http://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2013/05/09/executive-order-making-open-and-machine-readable-new-default-government-), The [Department of State](http://www.state.gov/) requires a versatile, readily-available, and understandable outlet for the dispersal of open government data and code. [GitHub](https://github.com/) has been a popular space for hosting versioned data in the public sector for some time. Recently, it has seen a good deal of participation from federal agencies such as the [General Services Administration](https://github.com/GSA) and [Environmental Protection Agency](http://www2.epa.gov/webguide/github-guidance). 
 
The [Office of eDiplomacy](http://www.state.gov/m/irm/ediplomacy/) has established a presence for the Department of State on GitHub in the [U.S. Department of State GitHub Organization](https://github.com/USStateDept).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
